median.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a narrow area of land that separates the two sides of a big road in order to keep traffic travelling in different directions apart
median.translation[0].definitions[1].def: the middle number or measurement in a set of numbers or measurements that have been arranged in order
median.translation[0].definitions[2].def: a line passing from one of the points of a triangle to the centre of the opposite side
median.translation[1].definitions[0].def: being the middle number or measurement in a set of numbers or measurements that have been arranged in order
median.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The median age of the group is 42.
median.translation[1].definitions[1].def: in or passing through the middle of something
median.translation[2].definitions[0].def: the median number is the middle one in a series of numbers, arranged in order
median.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: The median sales price fell 1.4% from October.
Median household income fell by 1.9% last year.
